message_1: A block cipher uses a 128-bit key and operates on 64-bit blocks. Suppose we have a plaintext block of 0x0123456789ABCDEF which is being encrypted using a key of 0x133457799BBCDFF1. What would be the resulting ciphertext block?
message_2: To determine the resulting ciphertext block, we need to know which specific block cipher algorithm is being used (e.g., AES, DES, etc.). The encryption process and resulting ciphertext will vary depending on the algorithm. Please provide the block cipher algorithm being used for this encryption.
